name: WordPress
comparison_text: WordPress powers 60% of the web, but itâ€™s a security nightmare relying on dozens of plugins. BasaltCMS is a secure, high-performance React-based headless CMS with zero plugin dependencies.

name: Shopify
comparison_text: Shopify is great for quick stores but traps you in their ecosystem. BasaltCMS offers true headless commerce freedom, letting you build custom storefronts without transaction fee penalties.

name: Wix
comparison_text: Wix builds sites you can never export. BasaltCMS generates clean, exportable Next.js code that you own 100%, hosting it wherever you want.

name: Squarespace
comparison_text: Squarespace looks good until you need custom logic. BasaltCMS combines beautiful design with infinite backend scalability and open API extensibility.

name: Joomla!
comparison_text: Joomla lives in the PHP past. BasaltCMS brings you to the modern edge of TypeScript, Server Components, and AI automation.

name: Drupal
comparison_text: Drupal requires a dedicated dev team to maintain. BasaltCMS offers the same enterprise-grade permissions and workflows but is managed by AI agents.

name: Webflow
comparison_text: Webflow's CMS is rigidly tied to its visual builder. BasaltCMS gives you a visual editor for marketers but a fully decoupled, unlimited backend for developers.

name: Adobe (AEM)
comparison_text: AEM costs millions to license and implement. BasaltCMS delivers superior Digital Experience capabilities at a fraction of the cost and implementation time.

name: Tilda
comparison_text: Tilda makes pretty blocks. BasaltCMS makes smart blocks that adapt to user behavior using real-time predictive AI.

name: Duda
comparison_text: Duda is good for small sites. BasaltCMS allows agencies to deploy complex web apps and portals across thousands of clients instantly.

name: HubSpot CMS Hub
comparison_text: HubSpot forces you to learn HubL. BasaltCMS uses standard React and TypeScript, so your developers are instantly productive.

name: Sitecore
comparison_text: Sitecore is the dinosaur of personalization. BasaltCMS uses lightweight AI at the edge to personalize content without slowing down page loads.

name: BigCommerce
comparison_text: BigCommerce has limits. BasaltCMS's event-driven architecture handles unlimited traffic spikes without rate limiting your growth.

name: Contentful
comparison_text: Contentful gives you an API. BasaltCMS gives you an API plus fully rendered front-end components and AI content generation tools.

name: Optimizely
comparison_text: Optimizely feels like unmatched parts glued together. BasaltCMS is a unified platform where CMS, Analytics, and AI are built as one.

name: WooCommerce
comparison_text: WooCommerce slows down as you grow. BasaltCMS stays blazingly fast with a serverless database that scales to millions of SKUs.

name: TYPO3
comparison_text: TYPO3 is notoriously hard to learn. BasaltCMS offers the same robust multi-language support wrapped in an interface your grandmother could use.

name: Contentstack
comparison_text: Contentstack is priced for the Fortune 500. BasaltCMS democratizes composable architecture for startups and scale-ups.

name: Storyblok
comparison_text: Storyblok's visual editor can be clunky. BasaltCMS uses a native React canvas for buttery smooth real-time previews and editing.

name: Kentico Xperience
comparison_text: Kentico ties you to .NET. BasaltCMS is built on standards-based web technologies deployable to Vercel, Netlify, or AWS.

name: Magnolia
comparison_text: Magnolia brings Java enterprise baggage. BasaltCMS is lightweight, serverless, and ready for the edge.

name: Sanity
comparison_text: Sanity requires learning GROQ. BasaltCMS works with standard GraphQL and SQL, so you don't need to retrain your team.

name: Liferay
comparison_text: Liferay feels like corporate 2005. BasaltCMS builds modern, reactive employee experiences that feel like consumer apps.

name: Progress Sitefinity
comparison_text: Sitefinity upgrades are painful projects. BasaltCMS is SaaS-delivered and always up to date with zero downtime.

name: Ghost
comparison_text: Ghost is great for blogs but fails at apps. BasaltCMS powers your blog AND your SaaS application from the same content core.
